Job Posting:163689 - Position: S25 Software Developer Co-Op 163689 E3 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 03/14/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 02/21/2025 10:05 AM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country Oracle Communications Inc. Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Salary Currency Salary Job Description 2025 - Summer S25 Software Developer Co-Op 163689 E3 Co-op Position Kitchener, ON Canada 4 months CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List Job Title: Software Developer Co-Op - May 2025 Start Job ID: 262569 Job Description At Oracle NetSuite, we build the best-in-class system for automating business processes. We help our customers run their businesses and scale with them as they grow. As a premier part of Oracle's organization, Development teams at NetSuite enjoys a start-up culture with the added benefits of the strength and stability of a global organization. Our work environment is open and agile. We thrive on collaboration and global partnership to build a seamlessly integrated suite of features and flexible solutions. We have developers and product owners in eight offices worldwide, all rallying around one common purpose - helping our customers achieve their goals.NetSuite developers do more than write code. We become specialists in our business domain and take the time to deeply understand our customers' goals. We own the design of our product, bringing questions and ideas to the table and analyzing them. We develop greenfield code for new engines as well as maintain a powerful legacy codebase. So, you're interested in a co-op? We're looking for students who have great attention to detail, are currently enrolled in a Computer Science or Engineering degree with at least 1+ years of software development and object-oriented programming experience (academic or industry). If you enjoy critical thinking and problem solving and are a strong communicator, take this as a sign to apply! Co-Op students at NetSuite are a key part of the larger teams success and are treated like full-time employees. When you join our co-op program, you will be given a mentor to help you succeed and achieve your goals. We have a thriving co-op social program across our North American offices and create the space for you to network with and get to know our senior leaders. Looking for more information? Responsibilities Curious about what you'll do? Here's a sample of tasks and projects our co-op's work on: • Implement a database-driven web application, its features and tests. • Join the team's code review process in an active and timely fashion. • Take part in the resolution of production issues and work with team members, including Technical Support teams, to see the resolution through to completion. • Collaborate with fellow team members across all roles to deliver on a shared responsibility for quality. • Participate in writing automated tests to ensure comprehensive test coverage of features. • Assist in product roadmap discussions and implementation. • Follow the mentorship of full-time team members. • Participate in initiatives that make us stronger as a team (e.g. internal dash-boarding, metrics for our success in production, improved build processes). Contribute ideas and effort for continuous improvement for the team, in its Agile process and in its general team effectiveness. • Job Requirements We encourage you to apply if you have most (or all!!) of the following: • Experience with Java and SQL • Understanding of HTML, CSS and DOM • • A passion for software quality Knowledge of QA processes and methodologies is a plus • Co-op/intern or other industry experience in software is a plus • Enrolled in a Bachelors/Masters degree program and grad date no later than August 2026 • Reside in the Canada and/or attend a university in Canada. Able to acquire work authorization in Canada in 2025. • Preferred Qualifications: Minimum 3.0 GPA • This job requires proficiency in the English language. Oracle is a global company with operations in dozens of countries around the world and our teams, including the team this position is part of, are comprised of individuals located in various jurisdictions. As is required of employees in all jobs at Oracle in North America, candidates for this position are required to understand, and communicate, in English so that in the course of performing their work, they can interact with teammates in other locations who are not fluent in the French language. Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Optional Address Cover Letter to Hiring Manager Special Application Instructions Application Link: https://eeho.fa.us2.oraclecloud.com/hcmUI/CandidateExperience/en/sites/jobsearch/job/262569/?utm_medium=jobshare Indicate your interest to apply to this position in SCOPE and also submit your application package via the online website portal. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may expire at any time. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
